body:
$!Child Benefit payments usually stop after 8 weeks if your child goes into care - unless it's because of an illness or a disability.$!

[Tell the Child Benefit Office](https://directgov-online.hmrc.gov.uk/shortforms/form/CBO_General?dept-name=CBO&sub-dept-name=General&location=3&origin=http://www.hmrc.gov.uk "email the Child Benefit Office"){:rel="external"} if your child goes into care - they will tell you if you’ll still get Child Benefit.

You can [claim again for Child Benefit](/child-benefit/how-to-claim "claim Child Benefit") after 8 weeks if your child is still in care but at home for either:

- 7 days or more in a row before going back into care (you can claim Child Benefit for the time they spent at home)
- at least 24 hours every week (you’ll get Child Benefit as long as that continues)

$C 
**Child Benefit Helpline**   
**Telephone:** 08453 021 444  
**Textphone:** 08453 021 474   
8am to 8pm, Monday to Friday  
8am to 4pm, Saturday  
$C

^There are different rules if your child is in residential care or hospital because of an [illness or disability](child-benefit-hospital-residential-care "Child Benefit if your child is in hospital or residential care").^
overview: The rules about Child Benefit if your child goes into care - what you have to do, when payments stop, when you can claim again
title: Child Benefit if your child goes into care
